page.title: 09Local Buildings
page.content:
The buildings in Morley are of different types and ages. There are three large houses which date back several centuries, namely Morley Hall, Morley Old Hall and Morley Manor. The other houses are a mixture of old styles and ages. The oldest are of clay lump and have thatched roofs. There are many local sources of thatching material from the Norfolk broads and coastal marshland. The clay was dug up locally and many fields still have marl pits tucked away in odd corners. Other houses are of various modern designs including timber frame and board and brick. Many local houses have roofs of traditional Norfolk pantiles.
SC21CS
